content: Despite the lower gross margins, the team delivered $9.7 million in adjusted EBITDA, up almost 600% from prior year on $71.2 million in revenue demonstrating very strong operating leverage in the quarter. While we have not yet returned to pre-COVID levels of activity, we experienced a solid 35% improvement in our Q1 quick turn business over the prior year quarter as maintenance spending is showing positive signs of recovery, particularly in North America. While down 14% from the prior year period on a trailing 12 month basis, we have reached an inflection point with orders up 19% in the quarter over the prior year period and a positive book-to-bill resulting in backlog growth of 5% year-over-year. Scott, I think, I am following you, but it's you've – I think you might have also answered your own question too, when you think about the mix within the mix and as that changes on a quarter-to-quarter or year-over-year basis, but I think philosophically you're on the right path as we look to those margins in the backlog if they've higher than they've been before, at some point they're going to accrete in.
